speciesPhotos.alt: A purple frog with a pointed snout emerging from soil

funFacts.title: Living Fossil
funFacts.description: Purple frogs have been around for 130 million years - since the time of dinosaurs!

funFacts.title: Underground Life
funFacts.description: They spend most of their life underground, only coming up for about two weeks each year to breed.

funFacts.title: Special Snout
funFacts.description: Their pointy nose helps them eat termites and ants underground.

funFacts.title: Chicken Call
funFacts.description: Males make a sound like a chicken clucking to attract females!

sizeComparison.comparedTo: About the size of a chicken egg

researcher.name: Dr. Karina Patel
researcher.quote: Every time I find a purple frog, it feels like discovering a tiny dinosaur. These animals connect us to a world 130 million years ago!
researcher.story: Dr. Karina has been studying purple frogs in India's Western Ghats for over 10 years. She works with local communities to protect the forests where these unique frogs live. When she's not in the field, she loves teaching kids about amphibian conservation.
